org.jdrupes

Interface Manager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Component>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractComponent, org.jdrupes.internal.ComponentNode

    public interface Manager
extends java.lang.Iterable<Component>
    Provides methods for manipulating the component hierarchy and for firing events. Every component has access to a manager implementation that manages the component.

    The Manager for a component that extends from AbstractComponent is provided by the base class itself. Components that only implement the Component interface get an associated Manager assigned to their annotated attribute.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Manager addChild(Component child)
      Adds the given component node as a child to the component managed by this manager.
      void addHandler(java.lang.Object eventKey, java.lang.Object channelKey, java.lang.String method)
      A shortcut for invoking addHandler(Object, Object, String, int) with priority 0.
      void addHandler(java.lang.Object eventKey, java.lang.Object channelKey, java.lang.String method, int priority)
      Adds a method of the component managed by this manager as a handler for a specific event and channel.
      Component detach()
      Detaches the component managed by this manager (and its children, if any) from the component tree that it currently belongs to.
      void fire(Event event, Channel... channels)
      Fires the given event on the given channel.
      Channel getChannel()
      Returns the channel if the component managed by this manager.
      java.util.List<Component> getChildren()
      Returns the child components of the component managed by this manager as unmodifiable list.
      Component getParent()
      Returns the parent of the component managed by this manager.
      Component getRoot()
      Returns the root of the tree the component managed by this manager belongs to.
      void removeChild(Component child)
      Removes the given component from the set of children of the component managed by this manager.

      • detach

        Component detach()
        Detaches the component managed by this manager (and its children, if any) from the component tree that it currently belongs to.
        Returns:
        the component (for comfortable chaining)

      • addChild

        Manager addChild(Component child)
        Adds the given component node as a child to the component managed by this manager.
        Parameters:
        child - the component to add
        Returns:
        the component's manager (for comfortable chaining)

      • removeChild

        void removeChild(Component child)
        Removes the given component from the set of children of the component managed by this manager.
        Parameters:
        child - the component to be removed

      • getChildren

        java.util.List<Component> getChildren()
        Returns the child components of the component managed by this manager as unmodifiable list.
        Returns:
        the child components

      • getParent

        Component getParent()
        Returns the parent of the component managed by this manager.
        Returns:
        the parent component or null if the component is not registered with another component

      • getRoot

        Component getRoot()
        Returns the root of the tree the component managed by this manager belongs to.
        Returns:
        the root

      • getChannel

        Channel getChannel()
        Returns the channel if the component managed by this manager.
        Returns:
        the channel that the component's handlers listen on by default and that fire(Event, Channel...) sends the event to

      • fire

        void fire(Event event,
        Channel... channels)
        Fires the given event on the given channel. If no channels are specified as parameters, the event is fired on the event's channel (see Event.getChannels()). If the event doesn't specify channels either, the event is fired on the channel of the component managed by this manager (see getChannel()). As last resort, the event is fired on the broadcast channel.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire
        channels - the channels to fire the event on

      • addHandler

        void addHandler(java.lang.Object eventKey,
              java.lang.Object channelKey,
              java.lang.String method,
              int priority)
        Adds a method of the component managed by this manager as a handler for a specific event and channel. The method with the given name must have a single argument of type Event (or a derived type as appropriate for the event type to be handled).
        Parameters:
        eventKey - the event key that should be used for matching this handler with an event. This is equivalent to an events/namedEvents parameter used with a single value in the handler annotation, but here all kinds of Objects are allowed as key values.
        channelKey - the channel key that should be used for matching this handler with a channel. This is equivalent to a channels/namedChannels parameter used with a single value in the handler annotation, but here all kinds of Objects are allowed as key values. If the actual object provided is a Channel, its match key is used for matching.
        method - the name of the method that implements the handler
        priority - the priority of the handler

      • addHandler

        void addHandler(java.lang.Object eventKey,
              java.lang.Object channelKey,
              java.lang.String method)
        A shortcut for invoking addHandler(Object, Object, String, int) with priority 0.
